isis.stitle: INSTRUMENTS - 1000 SERIES From 01/01/1998 to 02/07/2004 - OPERATION - INDICATOR AND WARNING LIGHTS

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signal Indicators - Left Turn Signal
svcsubproc.para: When the left turn signal is selected, power is applied from fuse F3 through flasher 4A to pin A of connector (193). The circuit continues on circuits 56 and 56C through pin 6 of connector (27). This causes the left turn indicator, which is grounded through pin 2 of connector (27) and circuit 28-GB, to illuminate when the flasher makes the turn signal blink.

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signal Indicators - Right Turn Signal
svcsubproc.para: When the right turn signal is selected, power is applied from fuse F3 through flasher 4A to pin D of connector (193). The circuit continues on circuits 57 and 57C through pin 12 of connector (27). This causes the right turn indicator, which is grounded through pin 2 of connector (27) and circuit 28-GB, to illuminate as the flasher makes the turn signal blink.

svcsubproc.title: Water-In-Fuel
svcsubproc.para: When the fuel filter has water in it, the water probe provides a ground at pin A of connector (2) on circuit 19C to pin D of the water-in-fuel module. The water-in-fuel module supplies 12 volts on circuit 19L through pin 11 of connector (28) to illuminate the "WATER-IN-FUEL" indicator.

svcsubproc.title: Wait-to-Start
svcsubproc.para: The "WAIT-TO-START" indicator is controlled by the ECM. A ground is sent from the ECM through pin 53 of connector (379), through pin 28 of connector (3), to pin 5 of connector (28). This causes the indicator to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight Hi-Beam
svcsubproc.para: When the headlight switch (60) is in the on position, power is supplied to the dimmer relay (4J) on pins 1 and 3. When the high beam switch (15) is activated, the ground on circuit 51-G through pin A of connector (192) to the switch is removed as the switch is opened. This removes the ground on circuit 51D to contact 2 of dimmer relay (4J), causing the relay to de-energize. This applies 12 volts to contact 4 of the relay on circuits 52C and 52A, through pin 4 of connector (27), to illuminate the high beam indicator on the instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: Change Oil
svcsubproc.para: The "CHANGE OIL" indicator is initiated by the ECM. A ground is sent on pin 45 of connector (379), on circuit 97AA through pin 18 of connector (3), to pin 7 of connector (28). The ground causes the indicator to illuminate.

note.para: The Change Oil/Service interval light default setting is off. The customer can use the service tool to activate the light and enter their own parameters into the ECM memory. The STI button (diagnostics flash button) is used to reset the service interval reminder light.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Filter
svcsubproc.para: When the fuel filter becomes clogged or restricted, the fuel filter vacuum switch (2FF) will close applying a ground on circuit 19B through pin B of connector (401), on circuit 19E to pin R of connector (2), on circuit 19B to pin 3 of connector (28), which illuminates the "FUEL FILTER" indicator.

svcsubproc.title: Suspension Low Air
svcsubproc.para: A ground from circuit 61-G through pin A of connector (475) is present at the air pressure sensor. When the suspension air pressure is low, the air pressure sensor will close applying ground through pin C of connector (475) on circuits 40 and 40A to pin 13 of connector (28). This causes the suspension low air indicator to illuminate and the alarm, which receives power and the ground through connector (474), to sound.

svcsubproc.title: Warning Engine
svcsubproc.para: The "WARN ENGINE" indicator is controlled by the ECM. Inputs from the engine sensors to the ECM are processed to determine this condition. A ground is sent from the ECM through pin 55 of connector (379), through pin 25 of connector (3), to pin 15 of connector (28), which causes the indicator to illuminate and the audible alarm to sound.

svcsubproc.title: Oil/Water
svcsubproc.para: The "OIL/WATER" indicator is controlled by the ECM. The ECM receives inputs from the engine sensors and the coolant surge tank. These inputs are processed to determine this condition. A ground is sent from the ECM through pin 54 of connector (379), through pin 16 of connector (3), to pin 14 of connector (28), which illuminates the indicator.

svcsubproc.title: Brake Pressure
svcsubproc.para: When the hydraulic brake module (49) detects a problem with the brake system, it provides a ground on circuit 90T to pin 9 of connector (28). The brake pressure warning light, which is powered by fuse F13, will illuminate and an audible alarm will sound.

svcsubproc.title: Park Brake
svcsubproc.para: When the parking brake is engaged the park brake switch (1PB) will close providing a ground on circuit 44A and 44 to pin 17 of connector (28) causing the "Park Brake" indicator to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Low Voltage
svcsubproc.para: When the voltage output of the alternator is low, a ground will be provided on terminal (1) of the alternator. This ground will be present on circuit 1C to pin 16 of connector (28) and will cause the low voltage indicator to illuminate.
